introduction.html.title: Introduction
introduction.html.body:
Introduction
HiAI Media is an API media library that helps developers easily obtain camera-captured images and audio data. The media library runs on the application layer of the Ascend 310-powered OS on the Atlas DK developer board. Video streams and audio streams in various formats can be easily obtained by calling API functions. These APIs also allow you to easily control the operating modes of the cameras and MIC devices on the Atlas DK developer board and query their operating status and various supported parameters.
HiAI Media can:

Initialize the media library.
Control media devices, including enabling and disabling cameras and microphones and setting parameters for operating, such as the frame rate, resolution, and audio sampling rate.
Query the supported operating modes and current running status of media devices, such as the supported resolution and the online status of cameras.
Collect audio and video streams and processes the raw audio and video data based on the algorithms according to user-defined requirements.

media-library-apis.html.title: Media Library APIs
media-library-apis.html.body:
Media Library APIs
The APIs of HiAI Media are based on the C language. The following describes each API in detail.
The definitions of APIs are saved to the  $HOME/tools/che/ddk/ddk/include/inc/driver/peripheral_api.h  file.

MediaLibInit  

IsChipAlive  

QueryCameraIds  

QueryCameraStatus  

OpenCamera  

SetCameraProperty  

GetCameraProperty  

CapCamera  

ReadFrameFromCamera  

CloseCamera  

QueryMICStatus  

OpenMIC  

SetMICProperty  

GetMICProperty  

CapMIC  

ReadMicSound  

CloseMIC

medialibinit.html.title: MediaLibInit
medialibinit.html.body:
MediaLibInit
Initializes the internal status of the media library. This API must be called before you call the media library function.
Syntax
int MediaLibInit()
Parameter Description

Parameter

Description

Value Range



-

-

-





Return Value
For details about the returned error codes, see the  Error Code  column in  Error Codes.
Error Codes

True Value

Error Code

Description



0

LIBMEDIA_STATUS_FAILED

The media library fails to be initialized.


1

LIBMEDIA_STATUS_OK

The media library is successfully initialized.

ischipalive.html.title: IsChipAlive
ischipalive.html.body:
IsChipAlive
Checks whether Hi3559 is properly connected with Ascend 310 on the Atlas DK developer board.
Syntax
int IsChipAlive(char* chipName)
Parameter Description

Parameter

Description

Value Range



chipName

Name of the chip interconnected with Ascend 310 Currently, only Hi3559 is supported.

The value is 3559.





Return Value
For details about the returned error codes, see the  Error Code  column in  Error Codes.
Error Codes

True Value

Error Code

Description



0

LIBMEDIA_STATUS_FAILED

The interconnection with Hi3559 fails.


1

LIBMEDIA_STATUS_OK

The interconnection with Hi3559 is normal.

querycameraids.html.title: QueryCameraIds
querycameraids.html.body:
QueryCameraIds
Queries the available camera channel IDs on the Atlas DK developer board. Currently, the developer board supports a maximum of two cameras at the same time.
Syntax
uint32_t QueryCameraIds(int* cameraIds, uint32_t *count)
Parameter Description

Parameter

Description

Value Range



cameraIds

Array for storing the query result

An array with the size of at least 2*sizeof(int) should be provided to save the returned result.
 NOTE: If the size of the user-provided array exceeds the actual number of cameras, the function sets the invalid ID to â€“1. The valid ID is 0 or 1.



count

Number of IDs that can be contained in the cameraIds array space

[1,2]





Return Value
For details about the returned error codes, see the  Error Code  column in  Error Codes.
Error Codes

True Value

Error Code

Description



0

LIBMEDIA_STATUS_FAILED

The query fails.


1

LIBMEDIA_STATUS_OK

The query is successful.

querycamerastatus.html.title: QueryCameraStatus
querycamerastatus.html.body:
QueryCameraStatus
Queries the current operating status of the camera with a specified ID.
Syntax
enum CameraStatus  QueryCameraStatus(int cameraId)
Parameter Description

Parameter

Description

Value Range



cameraId

Specified camera ID

[0, 1]





Return Value
For details about the returned error codes, see the  Error Code  column in  Error Codes.
Error Codes

True Value

Error Code

Description



1

CAMERA_STATUS_OPEN

The camera is opened.


2

CAMERA_STATUS_CLOSED

The camera is closed.


3

CAMERA_NOT_EXISTS

The camera does not exist.


4

CAMERA_STATUS_UNKOWN

The camera status is unknown.

opencamera.html.title: OpenCamera
opencamera.html.body:
OpenCamera
Opens the specified camera. You need to open the camera before performing related operations.
Syntax
int OpenCamera(int cameraId)
Parameter Description

Parameter

Description

Value Range



cameraId

Specified camera ID

[0, 1]





Return Value
For details about the returned error codes, see the  Error Code  column in  Error Codes.
Error Codes

True Value

Error Code

Description



0

LIBMEDIA_STATUS_FAILED

The camera fails to be opened.


1

LIBMEDIA_STATUS_OK

The camera is successfully opened.

setcameraproperty.html.title: SetCameraProperty
setcameraproperty.html.body:
SetCameraProperty
Sets and modifies the properties of a specified camera.
Syntax
int SetCameraProperty(int cameraId, enum CameraProperties prop, const void* pInValue)
Parameter Description

Parameter

Description

Value Range



cameraId

Specified camera ID

[0, 1]


prop

Type of a camera property

Only the following properties are supported:
enum CameraProperties
{
CAMERA_PROP_RESOLUTION =1,     // [Read/Write] resolution. The data type is CameraResolution*, and the length is 1.
CAMERA_PROP_FPS =2,     // [Read/Write] frame rate. The data type is uint32_t.
CAMERA_PROP_CAP_MODE =5,   // [Read/Write] Frame data can be obtained either actively or passively. The data type is CameraCapMode.
};


pInValue

Value of a property

See the preceding description. Each property has its own structure. Pay attention to the input data type.





Return Value
For details about the returned error codes, see the  Error Code  column in  Error Codes.
Error Codes

True Value

Error Code

Description



0

LIBMEDIA_STATUS_FAILED

Camera properties fail to be set.


1

LIBMEDIA_STATUS_OK

Camera properties are successfully set.

getcameraproperty.html.title: GetCameraProperty
getcameraproperty.html.body:
GetCameraProperty
Obtains the value of the specified property of a camera.
Syntax
int GetCameraProperty(int cameraId, enum CameraProperties prop, void* pValue)
Parameter Description

Parameter

Description

Value Range



cameraId

Specified camera ID

0~1


prop

Type of a camera property

Only the following properties are supported:
enum CameraProperties
{
CAMERA_PROP_RESOLUTION =1,     // [Read/Write] resolution. The data type is CameraResolution*. The length is 1CAMERA_PROP_FPS =2,     // [Read/Write] frame rate. The data type is uint32_t.
CAMERA_PROP_SUPPORTED_RESOLUTION  =4,   // [Read] used to obtain all the resolution lists supported by the camera. The data type is CameraResolution*, and the array length is HIAI_MAX_CAMERARESOLUTION_COUNT.
CAMERA_PROP_CAP_MODE =5,   // [Read/Write] Frame data can be obtained either actively or passively. The data type is CameraCapMode.
};


pInValue

Value of a property

See the preceding description. Each property has its own structure. Pay attention to the input data type.





Return Value
For details about the returned error codes, see the  Error Code  column in  Error Codes.
Error Codes

True Value

Error Code

Description



0

LIBMEDIA_STATUS_FAILED

Camera properties fail to be obtained.


1

LIBMEDIA_STATUS_OK

Camera properties are successfully obtained.

capcamera.html.title: CapCamera
capcamera.html.body:
CapCamera
Captures camera image data using the callback function. A callback function has to be provided for the media library. If images are generated at the bottom layer, the callback function will be called by the underlying thread of the media library. You are advised to copy the image data to the specified buffer in the callback function for the subsequent processing.
Syntax
int CapCamera(int cameraId, CAP_CAMERA_CALLBACK , void* param)
The format of the callback function is as follows:
typedef int (*CAP_CAMERA_CALLBACK) (const void* pdata, int size, void* param)
Parameter Description
The following table describes the parameters of the CapCamera function.

Parameter

Description

Value Range



cameraId

Specified camera ID

[0, 1]


CAP_CAMERA_CALLBACK

Callback function used to receive data

Valid address of a callback function


param

User-defined callback parameter

After receiving the image data, the media library returns this parameter to the user through the callback function.





The following table describes the parameters of the callback function.

Parameter

Description

Value Range



pdata

Address of a frame of image data

This buffer is maintained by the media library and is read-only to users. Users themselves cannot release the memory that the address points to. Otherwise, exceptions may occur.


size

Image data size

The value varies according to the image format and resolution.


param

User-defined callback parameter

After receiving the image data, the media library returns this parameter to the user through the callback function.





Return Value
For details about the returned error codes, see the  Error Code  column in  Error Codes.
Error Codes

True Value

Error Code

Description



0

LIBMEDIA_STATUS_FAILED

Image data fails to be captured.


1

LIBMEDIA_STATUS_OK

Image data is captured successfully.

readframefromcamera.html.title: ReadFrameFromCamera
readframefromcamera.html.body:
ReadFrameFromCamera
Reads the image data returned by cameras in a user thread. Note that this function returns values only after it receives image data. The user is responsible for providing a buffer for receiving image data. After receiving the complete image data of one frame, the media library copies the image data to the user-provided buffer.
Syntax
int ReadFrameFromCamera(int cameralId, void* pdata, int* size)
Parameter Description

Parameter

Description

Value Range



cameralId

Specified camera ID

[0, 1]


pdata

Pointer to the user-provided buffer

-


size

Size of the user-provided buffer, in bytes

You need to calculate the buffer size based on the preset image format and resolution to ensure that the buffer size is sufficient to store the output image data.





Return Value
For details about the returned error codes, see the  Error Code  column in  Error Codes.
Error Codes

True Value

Error Code

Description



0

LIBMEDIA_STATUS_FAILED

Image data fails to be captured.


1

LIBMEDIA_STATUS_OK

Image data is captured successfully.

querymicstatus.html.title: QueryMICStatus
querymicstatus.html.body:
QueryMICStatus
Queries the current operating status of the microphone on the Atlas DK developer board.
Syntax
enum MICStatus  QueryMICStatus()
Parameter Description

Parameter

Description

Value Range



-

-

-





Return Value
For details about the returned error codes, see the  Error Code  column in  Error Codes.
Error Codes

True Value

Error Code

Description



1

MIC_STATUS_OPEN

The microphone is opened.


2

MIC_STATUS_CLOSED

The microphone is closed.


3

MIC_NOT_EXISTS

The microphone does not exist.


4

MIC_STATUS_UNKOWN

The microphone status is unknown.

openmic.html.title: OpenMIC
openmic.html.body:
OpenMIC
Opens the microphone on the Atlas DK developer board. A micro-electro-mechanical systems (MEMS) microphone is embedded in the board. For details, see the product manual. If you need to use the recording function, place the sound source close to the MEMS microphone as possible before start recording.
Syntax
int OpenMIC()
Parameter Description

Parameter

Description

Value Range



-

-

-





Return Value
For details about the returned error codes, see the  Error Code  column in  Error Codes.
Error Codes

True Value

Error Code

Description



0

LIBMEDIA_STATUS_FAILED

The microphone fails to be opened.


1

LIBMEDIA_STATUS_OK

The microphone is successfully opened.

setmicproperty.html.title: SetMICProperty
setmicproperty.html.body:
SetMICProperty
Sets microphone properties and operating parameters.
Syntax
int SetMICProperty(struct MICProperties *propties)
Parameter Description

Parameter

Description

Value Range



propties

Data structure of a microphone property

struct MICProperties
{
enum AudioSampleRate sample_rate;               [Read/Write] sampling rate. The data type is uint32_t.
enum MICCapMode    cap_mode;                 [Read/Write] sound capture mode of the MIC
enum AudioBitWidth bit_width;                  [Read/Write] bit width of each sample
enum AudioSampleNumPerFrame frame_sample_rate; [Read/Write] number of samples per frame
enum AudioMode  sound_mode;                     [Read/Write] sound mode (which is mono or stereo)
};





Return Value
For details about the returned error codes, see the  Error Code  column in  Error Codes.
Error Codes

True Value

Error Code

Description



0

LIBMEDIA_STATUS_FAILED

Microphone properties fail to be set.


1

LIBMEDIA_STATUS_OK

Microphone properties are successfully set.

getmicproperty.html.title: GetMICProperty
getmicproperty.html.body:
GetMICProperty
Obtains the current operating property value of a microphone.
Syntax
int GetMICProperty(struct MICProperties *propties)
Parameter Description

Parameter

Description

Value Range



propties

Pointer to the property data structure provided by the user

For details, see the description of property values in SetMICProperty.





Return Value
For details about the returned error codes, see the  Error Code  column in  Error Codes.
Error Codes

True Value

Error Code

Description



0

LIBMEDIA_STATUS_FAILED

Microphone properties fail to be obtained.


1

LIBMEDIA_STATUS_OK

Microphone properties are successfully obtained.

capmic.html.title: CapMIC
capmic.html.body:
CapMIC
Captures audio data using a callback function. If the callback function generates a frame of audio data at the bottom layer, it will be called by the underlying thread of the media library. You are advised to copy the audio data to the specified buffer in the callback function for the subsequent processing.
Syntax
int CapMIC(CAP_MIC_CALLBACK, void* param)
The callback function is as follows:
typedef int (*CAP_MIC_CALLBACK) (const void* pdata, int size, void* param)
Parameter Description
The following table describes the parameters of the CapMIC function.

Parameter

Description

Value Range



CAP_CAMERA_CALLBACK

Callback function used to receive data

Valid address of a callback function


param

User-defined callback parameter

After receiving the audio data, the media library returns this parameter to the user through the callback function.





The following table describes the parameters of the callback function.

Parameter

Description

Value Range



pdata

Address of a frame of audio data

This buffer is maintained by the media library and is read-only to users. Users themselves cannot release the memory that the address points to. Otherwise, exceptions may occur.


size

Audio data size

The value varies according to the audio format and sampling rate.


param

User-defined callback parameter

After receiving the audio data, the media library returns this parameter to the user through the callback function.





Return Value
For details about the returned error codes, see the  Error Code  column in  Error Codes.
Error Codes

True Value

Error Code

Description



0

LIBMEDIA_STATUS_FAILED

Microphone audio data fails to be captured.


1

LIBMEDIA_STATUS_OK

Microphone audio data is successfully captured.

readmicsound.html.title: ReadMicSound
readmicsound.html.body:
ReadMicSound
Reads the audio data captured by the microphone in a user thread. Note that this function returns values only after it receives audio data. The user is responsible for providing a buffer for receiving audio data. After receiving the complete audio data of one frame, the media library copies the frame data to the user-provided buffer.
Syntax
int ReadMicSound(void* pdata, int *size)
Parameter Description

Parameter

Description

Value Range



pdata

Pointer to the user-provided buffer

-


size

Size of the user-provided buffer, in bytes

You need to calculate the buffer size based on the preset audio format and sampling rate to ensure that the buffer size is sufficient for the output audio data.





Return Value
For details about the returned error codes, see the  Error Code  column in  Error Codes.
Error Codes

True Value

Error Code

Description



0

LIBMEDIA_STATUS_FAILED

Microphone audio data fails to be read.


1

LIBMEDIA_STATUS_OK

Microphone audio data is successfully read.

closemic.html.title: CloseMIC
closemic.html.body:
CloseMIC
Closes a microphone.
Syntax
int CloseMIC()
Parameter Description

Parameter

Description

Value Range



-

-

-





Return Value
For details about the returned error codes, see the  Error Code  column in  Error Codes.
Error Codes

True Value

Error Code

Description

1

LIBMEDIA_STATUS_OK

appendix.html.title: Appendix
appendix.html.body:
Appendix
This chapter provides a complete example to describe how the APIs described in this document work, including opening the camera and microphone, modifying and querying their property parameters, calling the APIs for capturing video and audio data, saving the audio and video data streams to files, and closing the camera and microphone. This example code helps you get familiar with the API usage and then use these APIs flexibly based on actual project requirements.

Example

example.html.title: Example
